title: The race between hackers and the cybersecurity companies trying to stop them: Down to Business podcast
text:
Every week data breaches and cybersecurity lapses make the news. Millions of consumers have had their private information compromised, whether the targeted company was a retailer, a hotel, a bank or an insurance company.

At this point Canadian businesses know they need to take cybersecurity seriously, but how prepared are they for the inevitable attacks?

On this week’s Down to Business, host Emily Jackson speaks with Christy Wyatt, the chief executive of Absolute Software Corp., a Vancouver-based cybersecurity company. Absolute works with businesses to secure devices, data and applications. With a market cap over $324 million, it’s one of the largest publicly traded pure play cybersecurity companies in Canada.

They spoke about emerging cybersecurity risks and the state of the industry in Canada.
